initial_story:
The baby suffered a cardiac arrest at the theme park on Thursday

A woman has been arrested on suspicion of neglecting a five-month-old boy who suffered a cardiac arrest at a theme park.

The baby is in a critical condition in hospital following the incident at Legoland Windsor at about 13:00 BST on Thursday, police said.

A 27-year-old woman from Witham, Essex, was arrested on suspicion of neglecting a child to cause unnecessary injury.

She has been released on bail until 26 July.

Det Con Zoe Eele, of Thames Valley Police's Child Abuse Investigation Unit, said: "Firstly, our thoughts are with the family of the boy who is in a critical condition in hospital after suffering a cardiac arrest.

"We are working closely with the team at Legoland Windsor Resort but would like to speak to anyone who have information about this incident, specifically anyone who was queueing for the Coastguard HQ boat ride between around 11.30am and 12:45pm.

"I would ask for the public to please avoid speculation about the incident and to respect the boy's family at this deeply upsetting time."

Police said they are not looking for further suspects in relation to the incident.

In a statement, the theme park said: "On Thursday, a young guest was taken ill... and our fully trained First Aid team administered immediate care until the emergency services arrived.

"We will continue to support Thames Valley Police with their ongoing investigation."

Follow BBC South on Facebook, X, or Instagram. Send your story ideas to south.newsonline@bbc.co.uk or via WhatsApp on 0808 100 2240.

The BBC is not responsible for the content of external sites.
stories: The incident at Legoland Windsor has shocked many visitors to the theme park, with concerns raised about the safety of children in such attractions. The news of the baby's critical condition has left the community in disbelief, and many are waiting anxiously for updates on his condition. As the investigation continues, authorities are urging anyone with information to come forward to help shed light on what happened. The priority now is the well-being of the baby and his family during this difficult time.

Our thoughts and prayers are with the baby and his family as they navigate this challenging situation. It is important for the authorities to conduct a thorough investigation to determine the cause of the incident and prevent similar accidents from happening in the future. In the meantime, it is crucial for everyone to prioritize the safety and well-being of all visitors, especially children, at theme parks and other entertainment venues. Let us come together as a community to support the affected family and ensure that such incidents are prevented in the future.

We must also hold the responsible parties accountable for their actions to ensure justice is served. It is heartbreaking to hear about such tragic events, and it serves as a reminder of the importance of maintaining strict safety protocols at all times. Our hearts go out to the baby and his family during this difficult time, and we hope for a swift recovery and resolution. Let us work together to create a safer environment for all individuals, especially the most vulnerable among us.

By working together and holding those accountable for their actions, we can prevent future tragedies from occurring. It is crucial that we prioritize safety and take necessary precautions to protect those who cannot always protect themselves. Let us stand united in our efforts to create a safer and more compassionate world for all.
